turns.content: What is Founders and Coders (Finsbury Park, London)?

Founders and Coders is a non-profit organization that offers tuition-free web development training to people from diverse backgrounds. The organization was founded in 2014 in London and has since expanded to other locations around the world.

The training program is designed to be highly practical and project-based, with a focus on collaborative learning and peer-to-peer feedback. Students work on real-world projects and develop skills in web development, including front-end and back-end development, databases, and web security.

The program is supported by a community of mentors, volunteers, and industry partners who provide guidance, support, and career opportunities to graduates. Founders and Coders has a strong emphasis on social impact and aims to create opportunities for people who might not otherwise have access to tech education.

Founders and Coders has also launched a number of initiatives, such as the "Tech for Better" program, which provides web development services to non-profits and social enterprises, and the "Sustainable Web Development" program, which focuses on creating more environmentally sustainable web applications.
Who are the people of Founders and Coders( the mentors, volunteers, and industry partners who provide guidance, support, and career opportunities to graduates)?

Founders and Coders is supported by a diverse community of mentors, volunteers, and industry partners who provide guidance, support, and career opportunities to its graduates. Here are some of the key groups of people involved in Founders and Coders:

1. Mentors - Founders and Coders has a network of experienced mentors who work closely with the students. These mentors are experienced web developers who volunteer their time to provide guidance and support to the students.
2. Volunteers - Founders and Coders also relies on volunteers who help with various aspects of the program, such as organizing events, providing administrative support, and helping with marketing and outreach.
3. Industry Partners - Founders and Coders has established partnerships with a number of leading tech companies and startups. These partners provide career opportunities to graduates and also help to shape the curriculum to ensure that it is relevant to the needs of the tech industry.
4. Alumni - Founders and Coders also has a strong alumni community, with graduates who continue to be involved in the organization as mentors, volunteers, and supporters. The alumni community also provides a valuable network of contacts and resources for current students and recent graduates.
Is Dan Sofer related somehow to Anni Rowland-Campbell?

Yes, Dan Sofer and Anni Rowland-Campbell are related - they are brother and sister. Anni Rowland-Campbell is a co-founder of the organization with Dan Sofer, and together they have played a key role in shaping the vision and mission of Founders and Coders. Anni has a background in service design and has worked in the tech industry for many years, while Dan has a background in web development and has been involved with various tech startups over the years. Their complementary skill sets and shared vision for creating a more inclusive and equitable tech industry have been critical to the success of Founders and Coders.
